title: [BEAM-10827] Fix forward the google-cloud-core version

title: Support read/write ZetaSQL DATETIME/NUMERIC types from/to BigQuery
body:

title: Identify pair-with-none DoFn in CombineGlobally with a named URN.
body:
Unfortunately, this is a bit messy as the Fn's defnition is split across both the ParDo and DoFn instance, and we must maintain backwards compatibility with the legacy runner. For now only stateless functions are supported, but this mechanism can be extended for arbitrary DoFns. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-6868, BEAM-10670] Add support for bundle finalization to DoFnOperator for non-portable streaming pipelines.
body:
I used the UnboundedSourceFunction as a guide to implementing the bundle finalization hook for the DoFnOperator. Since checkpointing support is only supported when using shutdownSourcesAfterIdleMs so I added a new validates runner task that runs a subset of the tests that rely on bundle finalization. I also added support for Impulse translation for non-portable streaming pipelines. This is the base for swapping over non-portable Flink to use SDF instead of UnboundedSources. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10720] Finish implementing StringMethods (cat, repeat)
body:
This PR adds implementations for the non-trivial operations in `pd.Series.str`: - [`cat`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.Series.str.cat.html) can accept another Series or DataFrame making it a zipping operation, or it may produce a scalar. - [`repeat`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.Series.str.repeat.html) can accept another Series making it a zipping operation. title: [BEAM-10603] Implement the new Large Source Recording API.
body:
Change-Id: I660b98ac7cd562eb03aab6d15d829eae8726ebad The following API changes the way that the Interactive Runner caches data from unbounded sources. Previously, a user-configurable duration would run a "Background Caching Job" that would cache all elements from unbounded source. Then, the user pipeline would run by reading from that cache after completion. Now, there is a long lived "Background Recording Job". This replaces the caching job with a background pipeline that records elements from the unbounded sources and most importantly does not block user pipeline execution. The following APIs have changed: show(*pcolls, include_window_info=False, visualize_data=False) --> show(*pcolls, n='inf', duration='inf', include_window_info=False, visualize_data=False) The show() command was modified to include a max number of elements and a max duration of elements to read. The show() command will end when either of the limiters gets triggered, whichever comes first. If a limiter is not supplied it is assumed to be infinite. For example, show(pcoll, n=5000) will read and block until 5000 elements are read. collect(pcoll, include_window_info=False) --> collect(pcoll, n='inf', duration='inf', include_window_info=False) The collect() command was modified to include a max number of elements and a max duration of elements to read. The collect() command will end when either of the limiters gets triggered, whichever comes first. If a limiter is not supplied it is assumed to be infinite. For example, show(pcoll, n=5000) will read and block until 5000 elements are read. head() was removed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10603] Add describe and cancel to RecordingManager
body:
Change-Id: I414463dc40a58c1452b7f4a6e819b9e054e4cac8 This adds the ability to introspect into the RecordingManager to get the start time and size on cache for a recording or pipeline (RecordingManager). Also adds the "cancel" method to a recording. This allows to gracefully shutdown a recording if a kernel interrupt is caught. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10603] Fix BCJ termination conditions.
body:

This allows for the BCJ to be cancelled at any time. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10603] Gracefully shutdown the channel reader in the test_stream_impl
body:
Change-Id: I5fac037a7dcc141ff9d0ff8058fa3de993626c15 In the case that the kernel is interrupted we want to gracefully shutdown the grpc streaming request from the TestStream. Otherwsie, this throws an esoteric exception. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10775] Added a typescript precommit job
body:
1. The job runs 2 checks: jest for unit tests; eslint for lint and format. 2. The job is triggered on change under sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/interactive/extensions. Any typescript code outside this directory needs to be explicitly added to the trigger pattern and the copyTsSource task. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10773] Use the image flag before the default environment.
body:
Use an image when set by the worker_harness_container_image flag. The `image` variable stopped being consumed in https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/5f46b678e001d55621e5de719cf782160b1ba67d#diff-baacafffaacf38819d0a42b9d41d3174L228, which appears to have removed any ability to specific an image workers should use. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [X] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [X] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8758] Google-cloud-spanner upgrade to 1.59.0 and google_cloud_bigtable_client_core to 1.16.0
body:
Fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8758 R: @chamikaramj CC: @suztomo The changes are: 1. The main purpose of this commit is upgrading spanner library to 1.59.0, but to upgrade it, I need to also upgrade bigtable_client_core to 1.16.0 and other dependencies; 2. Update spanner type parser to be able to recognize NUMERIC. Note: 1. I have run "/bin/bash sdks/java/build-tools/beam-linkage-check.sh" and confirmed that there is no linkage errors. 2. I have run presubmit job and passed. ./gradlew spotlessApply && ./gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest javadoc spotbugsMain compileJava compileTestJava ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9680] Add Aggregation Sum lesson to Go SDK katas
body:
This pull request adds an aggregation sum lesson to the Go SDK katas. Just an FYI why there are `*-remote.yaml` files from other lessons included in this PR. When updating the [stepik course](https://stepik.org/course/70387), `*-remote.yaml` files from other lessons were also updated due to the whitespace corrections from fdeabb6 and e81c6f4. I would like to request the following reviewer: (R: @lostluck ) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10819] Upgrade Gradle to 6.1.1
body:
This PR upgrades the Gradle build tool from 5.2.1 to 6.1.1. Update build plugins to fix incompatibility: org.nosphere.apache.rat:0.4.0 -> 0.5.2 com.diffplug.gradle.spotless:3.24.0 -> 3.24.2 net.ltgt.gradle:gradle-apt-plugin:0.20 -> 0.21 com.google.protobuf:protobuf-gradle-plugin:0.8.5 -> 0.8.8 Replace deprecated build scan with new version: id 'com.gradle.build-scan' version '2.3' moved from build.gradle to settings.gradle and switch to new plugin id "com.gradle.enterprise" version "3.4.1" Increase build JVM memory to 4GB. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @lukecwik`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10808] Health checks streaming rpcs to streaming engine backend
body:
Add options, enabled by default, to control both grpc level channel health checks as well as application health checks for streaming rpcs sent to streaming engine. This allows for timely detection of channel errors which otherwise were only noticed once the rpc deadline was reached. Also add additional debugging information to the status page and increased control over logging. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10675] Clean up Python Load Tests
body:
BEAM-10675 has been resolved, which enables Python GroupByKey streaming loads tests using SyntheticSource as a source of input. As a result, the old GroupByKey pipeline that read input from PubSub became obsolete and can be removed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Removing dead code from Interactive Beam.
body:
Seems that no one has been referencing PipelineAnalyzer since BEAM-8016. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10812] fix(beam/sdks/go): fix buffer limit on textio
body:
bufio.Scanner is limited to 4kb by default, for arbitary line length it is recommended to use bufio.Reader and split by '\n' Ref: https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/src/bufio/scan.go#L27 issue identifyed by @salrashid123 Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: reduce disk usage in NativeFileSorter
body:

title: [BEAM-10703] Add a step property for shardable states during Dataflow graph translation (Java)
body:

title: [BEAM-5757] Add ElasticsearchIO: delete document support
body:
**What** This change introduces a new builder function (`withIsDeleteFn`) with `ElasticsearchIO.Write` which can be used to effectively delete documents from the Elasticsearch index. Previously, ElasticsearchIO only supports upsert operations within an index but it is impossible to delete documents. **Why** By using the `withIsDeleteFn` function, the apache beam user can dynamically decide the bulk operation to be carried out for the document. Mostly, in streaming update environment, it might happen that some of the previously indexed document needs to be deleted based on some conditions but the current version of ElasticsearchIO doesn't support delete operation and hence many users end up writing empty document for those IDs. This might have a major memory space issue while Elasticsearch's segment merging to free up deleted document's allocated memory. **JIRA Ticket** https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5757 R: @echauchot @jbonofre @timrobertson100 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Covnert.toRows should use setCoder, not setSchema
body:
Calling `setSchema` creates a new instance of `SchemaCoder`, which will not be represented as a standard coder `beam:coder:row:v1` in the Pipeline proto. By setting the coder directly we can reuse the instance of `RowCoder`. title: [BEAM-10788] Also disable immutability checking for transforms within Read.
body:
Beam Java never required sources to be "immutable" and also never required them to implement equals so migrating Java Direct runner to execute only SDFs has caused an increase of logs. This change disables this immutability checking for any transforms output produced by transforms part of the Read -> SDF expansion. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10673] Add public methods to RetryConfiguration.Builder in DynamoDBIO (aws2)
body:
io.aws2.dynamodb.DynamoDBIO.RetryConfiguration.Builder did not have a public build method. Also, validation was dropped in the conversion to the AutoValue builder pattern. (Related PR: [#8987](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/8987)) This PR makes relevant methods public, and implemented the validation in the build method in accordance to the [AutoValue guidelines](https://github.com/google/auto/blob/master/value/userguide/builders.md). Documentation was updated accordingly. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10781] Add PTransformOverride.get_replacement_transform_for_applied_ptransform()
body:
`PTransformOverride.get_replacement_transform_for_applied_ptransform()` is a new method that replaces `PTransformOverride.get_replacement_transform()`. This new method provides access to the `AppliedPTransform` when constructing the replacement transform, whereas the old method only provides access to the `PTransform`. - Introduces `PTransformOverride.get_replacement_transform_for_applied_ptransform(self, applied_ptransform)`. The user can override this to provide a replacement `PTransform` using the input `AppliedPTransform`. - Provides a default implementation of this method that calls `PTransformOverride.get_replacement_transform()` for backwards compatibility. - Deprecates `PTransformOverride.get_replacement_transform()`. title: [BEAM-10779] Support multiple main inputs and side inputs for PTransformOverride
body:
Currently, `PTransformOverride` only supports overriding `PTransform` s that have a single input. This change adds support for multiple main inputs and side inputs. The change introduces a new method `PTransformOverride.get_replacement_inputs(self, applied_ptransform)` that can be overridden by end users. This method will be called to get the inputs for the replacement `PTransform.` The default implementation will return a tuple of all the main inputs in order, concatenated with the all the side inputs `PValue` s in order. title: [BEAM-10758] Centralized Glob Translation Method
body:
I moved code translated globs to regular expressions that was duplicated in several filesystems to a central location. I also fixed a bug in the method. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10049] Add licenses for golang dependencies in python, java, and go SDK containers
body:
This PR uses [go-licenses](https://github.com/google/go-licenses) to find and download licenses for golang dependencies, then adds the license files to the Apache Beam SDK docker images for Python, Java, and Go. Licenses are only added when using -Pdocker-pull-licenses, which is consistent with the other licenses in [Beam container images instructions](https://beam.apache.org/documentation/runtime/environments/#building-container-images). Without -Pdocker-pull-licenses, no licenses/notices are added to the docker images. The go-licenses tool is run in a Docker container with a volume mounted to collect the license files. The files appear in the docker images in /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/golang For example: `./gradlew sdks:python:container:py37:docker -Pdocker-pull-licenses --info` `docker run -it --entrypoint bash apache/beam_python3.7_sdk:2.24.0.dev` `# find /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/golang -type f` R: @lostluck, @Hannah-Jiang ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10783] Remove the incorrect JoinScanWithRefConverter and use JoinScanConverter
body:
Current ZetaSQL implementation does not handle JOIN statement with WITH queries properly. It calculated the incorrect reference column indices. For example, if we run: ``` WITH t1 AS (select 1 AS k), t2 AS (select 1 AS k), t3 AS (select 1 AS k) SELECT COUNT(*) FROM t1 JOIN t3 USING (k) ``` It failed with `java.lang.AssertionError: RexInputRef index 2 out of range 0..1` somewhere in Calcite. JoinScanWithRefConverter does an extra step of mapping indices to column indices in the original WITH queries, which is not correct. In fact, the other converter responsible for JOINs, JoinScanConverter, has the correct implementation, and that works fine for JOINs that has reference to WITH queries. So here I delete the incorrect JoinScanWithRefConverter class and move to the other one. Also added some tests to prevent regression. r: @apilloud @amaliujia Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-10378] Deserializing Azure Credentials
body:
I wrote a deserializer for Azure credentials. Work in progress serializing credentials - I have encountered some challenges with this because Azure Identity credentials do not support this. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9680] Add Aggregation Count lesson to Go SDK katas
body:
This pull request adds an aggregation count lesson to the Go SDK katas. I needed to upgrade the go.mod to require [v2.23.0](https://github.com/apache/beam/releases/tag/v2.23.0) in order to make use of [stats.CountElms](https://godoc.org/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/go/pkg/beam/transforms/stats#CountElms) I would like to request the following reviewer: (R: @lostluck ) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10438] Update SupportedZetaSqlBuiltinFunctions and support math functions
body:
1. Sync with builtin_function.proto in ZetaSQL 2020.08.1 release 2. Turn on all scalar math functions supported by ZetaSQL evaluator and add unit tests for them 3. Move all existing unit tests for math functions to ZetaSqlMathFunctionsTest 4. title: [BEAM-10764] Make is_in_ipython robust
body:

title: [BEAM-10769] Clarify Avro IO documentation.
body:
Our Avro IO documentation instructs the user to pass the schema parsed by avro.schema.Parse. On Python 3, we use FastAvro module, which does not accept avro-python3 schema classes. This PR corrects this instruction. To make Py2->3 transition easier for the users, we try to catch if users continue to feed avro-python3 schemas into Avro IO and error-out with a better message. Also, fastavro does not require a parsed schema, since the schema is re-parsed anyway, see: [1], [2], it would be simpler to ask users to pass raw schema. [1] https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/1b6b60e9a690784ead18881d48a8dc3ab2ea95ad/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/avroio.py#L634 [2] https://github.com/fastavro/fastavro/blob/9b0cb9154df13e7bcf1b3eaf88c8ae7d6065666a/fastavro/_write_py.py#L381 Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-9919] Isolating xlang transforms by namespace
body:
All components of the xlang transform that aren't uniquely identified by topological ordering are now isolated into their respective namespaces. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10761] Prefer TestPubsub#assertSubscriptionEventuallyExists when waiting to inject data
body:
- Renamed `TestPubsub#checkIfAnySubscriptionExists` to `TestPubsub#assertSubscriptionEventuallyCreated` (original is still there and marked deprecated), and updated the docstring. - Use `TestPubsub#assertSubscriptionEventuallyCreated` everywhere that `TestPubsubSignal` was being used to block before injecting data into a pubsub topic. title: [BEAM-9118] Increase portable_runner_test timeout.
body:
The default pytest timeout is 600s. Once all portable runner tests are migrated to pytest, we can use the pytest timeout instead of portable_runner_test's bespoke implementation. See #12385. title: [BEAM-9919] Refining xlang types and wrappers
body:
Types used by xlang such as `graph.ExternalTransform` and `graph.ExpandedTranform` have been refined to make use of existing types such as`graph.Inbound` and `graph.Outbound`. All data operations related to input and output `graph.Node` counterparts of a pcollection associated with xlang have been simplified and segregated appropriately. In doing so, how the external node is being added to `graph.Graph` has been changed to afford easier composability. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10759] Uses reader Avro schema to deserialize in KafkaIO
body:
The existing ConfluentSchemaRegistryDeserializerProvider uses the writer schema to deserialize Avro records from Kafka, but passes a fixed schema to the AvroCoder. If the Kafka topic contains evolved schema, the AvroCoder will fail to encode the records. This commit uses the deserialize(bytes, readerSchema) method from KafkaAvroDeserializer, in order to deserialize Kafak Avro records with a schema consistent with AvroCoder. The change causes ConfluentSchemaRegistryDeserializerProviderTest to fail, due to an existing error. mockRegistryClient.register returns the schema id but not the schema version. With the changes in this commit, the mockRegistryClient will be called one more time, which in turns call mockRegistryClient.register(). This causes schema id and schema version to deviate. Therefore, the unit test is modified to correctly acquire the schema version. I have ran local test on the java sdk, and spotless test. The modified logic has been tested on an actual pipeline with Dataflow Runner, which successfully read from a topic with evolved schema. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10756] Fix empty pull response to not ack and to not throw IndexOutOfBoundsException
body:
------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10040, BEAM-6804] Increase wait times to reduce flakiness.
body:
Currently a lot of these tests take ~30 seconds on my machine which means that it is likely to flake since the timeout is on the same order of magnitude as the current test. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10753] Add Slack link invitation on README
body:
Using Slack for communication will be easier. We also can find the link invitation on https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/INFRA/Slack+Guest+Invites However, it's not directly listed on contact us, at least for now. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10669] Add support for Dataflow Templates in SnowflakeIO
body:
Changed basic types in SnowflakeIO to ValueProvider and refactored necessary functionalities due to support Dataflow Templates. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10720,BEAM-10721] Add skipped tests for Series.dt and Series.str methods

I noticed that a lot of useful pandas methods are hidden behind Series.dt and Series.str, and tested from separate modules. This PR adds some skipped tests for those modules. title: [BEAM-9980] Configure Python versions for direct test suite tasks via settings.gradle
body:
Made it possible for some direct test-suite tasks to configure which python version to use with gradle properties. And moved some tasks under test-suites/direct/py*/build.gradle to test-suites/direct/common.gradle. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
